page.title: 04Ecology and South Kyme
page.content: Dutch Elm disease killed many trees. Our wood is being replenished, and local farmers have planted 6000 trees. Daffodil bulbs have also been planted on the river bank, below the footpath. Climate is influenced by The Wash and flatness of the land. We get cold east winds, sea mists and moderate snow, usually at the end of January. In 1985 spring was cold, summer dull & very wet, October warm, sunny & very dry. Rabbits are few due to myxamatosis, but hares thrive. Pheasants are reared on farms, for the shooting season. There are some grey squirrels. Birds of prey are increasing:- Tawny, Barn & Little Owls, Kestrels, Marsh Harriers, and this year a Hobby was seen. The diminishing hedgerows and dykes, and the use of chemicals on the land, are causing concern with regard to the effect upon wildlife.
